title: Train Journey
context: A train is travelling north at 20 m/s. The driver applies the brakes and the train decelerates, coming to rest. It then reverses direction and travels south, reaching 15 m/s. Take north as the positive direction.

parts.question: What does the negative velocity between approximately 23 s and 40 s mean?

options.text: The train is moving south (opposite to the original direction)
The train is speeding up in the north direction

solutionSteps.text: North was defined as the positive direction.
A negative velocity means the train is moving in the opposite direction â€” south.
The train has not stopped â€” it is still moving, just in the opposite direction.
Common mistake: negative velocity does NOT mean the object is slowing down. It means it is moving in the negative direction.
